value.title: Troubleshoot missing applied filters in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you ever seen that a visual is being filtered and you can't find where that filter is? Whether it has happened to you yet or not, make sure you check this video so you know how to fix it when if happens. #curbal #powerbi  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: Working hours without Holidays, weekends and by country in power query
value.excerpt: In today's video we are going to write a function that calculates work hour (seconds) between two datetimes. Working hour by location, holidays will also be included :)  Link to Bills thread: https://social.technet.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/f3fc729e-a2ec-409a-b20e-b5cf8ff5dc2a/calculate-work-hours-between-two-timedate-stamps?forum=powerquery

value.title: Convert data from HTML to Plain Text using Power Query for Power BI Table Visualization
value.excerpt: As we all know, Power BI table visualization does not support HTML generation. So, we need to convert our HTML text to Plain text.   With the help of Power Query function, we can easily remove HTML tags from the Text in Power Query. To implement that we need to use function HTML.table() in Power Query.

value.title: 5 ways to get Power BI Support #pbifamily

value.title: Answering your Power BI Premium Per User Questions

PPU Video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dEgR2_xi3mw  PPU FAQ: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-per-user-faq

value.title: Are you backing up your Power BI Dataset???
value.excerpt: While Power BI is a SaaS service, backing up your dataset is still important. What if something was accidently deleted? How do you recover it? Patrick shows you how you can get a backup / restore process in place so you can sleep at night.  Backup/Restore PowerShell Script: https://guyinacu.be/backuprestorescript

value.title: Brand your Report Server
value.excerpt: I break down how to make a branding package for SQL Server Reporting Services 2016. I compare it from the original skin, to the multicolor brand package that Chris Finlan put together, to my custom brand package for Guy in a Cube.  Branding the web portal - https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/mt710551.aspx
